entry.title: Add support for buyerReportingId and buyerAndSellerReportingId from B&A response
entry.content: We need to verify that the buyerReportingId or buyerAndSellerReportingId used for reporting on the Bidding and Auction Services trusted server matches the corresponding reporting ID associated with the ad on device.

entry.title: Customer have detected random CORS issues when working with Chrome with icons stored in a public GCP
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem - Initially, Cx has provided the screenshot of an error message [1]. - Cx also mentioned that it is random (it not always happens on the same icons) but it always occurs when the request to the bucket is done from an environment after a previous request done from a different environment (i.e: they make a request from DEV and it’s ok and then they make a request from PRE and in some icons we get a CORS error). - As an example, Cx has made a request from DEV (left) and it’s ok whereas they request from ITG (right) and as we can see they get CORS errors because the header keeps a DEV value) [2]. - Cx has provided the screenshot of Headers DEV [3] & [4] and Headers ITG [5]. - Cx mentioned that all of their team has tried it and the error happens in all of their Chrome browsers. It does not happen though in Safari or Edge. [1] : https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7MAoutuPAFExD2p.png [2] : https://screenshot.googleplex.com/6Dhc6Nrvx2EgegT.png [3] : https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4CXcnqYioaWzJGk.png [4] : https://screenshot.googleplex.com/5agGUCCcLZyjxgA.png [5] : https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9qxD4TSxFYSZvkB.png
# Problem Description - As per the bug (b/333724082), Software Engineer mentioned that cx have correct CORS configuration setting and GCS is also sending correct response to every call. Taking into consideration that only Chrome user having this issue, we would recommend sending this issue to Chrome team to see if they have better insights. - For more information about the investigation of GCS, please check the bug (b/333724082).
# Additional Comments Vector Case No : https://metabug.corp.google.com/entity/142860541?audience=42 Bug Link : https://buganizer.corp.google.com/issues/333724082
# Summary Customer have detected random CORS issues when working with Chrome with icons stored in a public GCP
# Additional Data Category: Enterprise \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: No

entry.title: Tests are failing: dump_accessibility_browsertest_base.cc(561): Value of: accessibility_waiter.WaitForNotification()\n Actual: false\nExpected: true
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): dump_accessibility_browsertest_base.cc(561): Value of: accessibility_waiter.WaitForNotification()\n Actual: false\nExpected: true
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://content/test:content_browsertests/DumpAccessibilityTreeTest.AccessibilityCSSTransform/All.blink - ninja://content/test:content_browsertests/DumpAccessibilityTreeTest.AccessibilityIframeAriaHidden/All.blink - ninja://content/test:content_browsertests/DumpAccessibilityTreeTest.AccessibilityCSSIframeHidden/All.blink - ninja://content/test:content_browsertests/DumpAccessibilityTreeTest.AccessibilityCSSTransform/All.mac - ninja://content/test:content_browsertests/DumpAccessibilityTreeTest.AccessibilityIframeAriaHidden/All.uia
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/039f3c162e95951a259d28f540da10bf

entry.title: Add metrics to measure when budgets for sharedStorage.selectURL are hit
entry.content: We should record UMA to see how often calls to selectURL end up with an insufficient budget.

entry.title: Remove InsecureFormsWarningsEnabled after M130
entry.content: This is a temporary policy to support the insecure form warnings launch on iOS. Should be removed in M130.

entry.title: Inconsistent Web USB Communication on Windows Machines
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. I have website where we can login and capture the pulse data from usb sensor device 2. 3.

So for this web base communication I find the web serial so this not need any software installation and any other server.But this working correctly in mac Chrome but in some windows chrome (basically of 8 Gb ram) this not working properly this lossess the so much in between data and same for some bigger ram machines also, So I want the solution for this. So please help me in this.

#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know

entry.title: blink::InterestGroup violates the Google C++ style guide by being a class with public member variables.
entry.content:
Per the Google C++ style guide, "Make classes' data members private, unless they are constants."
blink::InterestGroup was converted from a struct to a class in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5111200 without making most of its member variables private.
I suggest switching it back to a struct, and making render_url_ public, like everything else (and possibly renaming it to render_url_string or somesuch).

entry.title: there's a builder called mac-osxbeta-rel that does Debug builds
entry.content:
It appears that we have a builder called `mac-osxbeta-rel` that tests Debug builds, despite the `-rel` in the name suggesting otherwise.
It seems like either (a) the builder should be renamed or (b) it should be configured to test Release builds. (I'm not sure what was intended.)
I noticed this as part of https://issues.chromium.org/issues/333758768#comment3 (which was a failure happening only on debug builds, although I briefly thought otherwise because of this builder's name) and checked that in the WPT log it says: ``` 16:42:28.754 4037 Baseline search path: mac -> generic 16:42:28.754 4037 Using Debug build 16:42:28.754 4037 Regular timeout: 30000, slow test timeout: 150000 ```
(As bpastene noted on `#ops` in Slack, this is an FYI builder.)

entry.title: NFC unable to communicate with other devices
[shared storage] Rename SharedStorageAPIM124 to SharedStorageAPIM125 and enable it
entry.content: Previously we decided to push this back to M125 and disabled the feature. Now we rename it to M125 and enable it.

entry.title: Request to add CIPD packages for the Android toolchain
entry.content: In [this Chromium bug](https://g-issues.chromium.org/issues/40913000), the team stripped down the Android NDK packages to include only the sysroot, and not the full toolchain. This makes sense for Chromium, but other projects (such as BoringSSL) are still reliant on an NDK distribution which contains the full toolchain. As such, I'd like to add an infra CIPD package for both `android_toolchain` and `android_toolchain_canary`. We can lift and shift the previous Chromium builders, before the aforementioned change landed.

``` ERROR at //ui/ozone/BUILD.gn:156:7: Unable to load "/b/s/w/ir/cache/builder/src/third_party/fuchsia-sdk/sdk/fidl/fuchsia.images/BUILD.gn". "//third_party/fuchsia-sdk/sdk/fidl/fuchsia.images:fuchsia.images_hlcpp", ```
we checkout the Fuchsia SDK in [DEPS](https://crsrc.org/c/DEPS;drc=e210451c0a44392313d356bcfc00456bf975f39c;l=1335) with the `checkout_fuchsia_no_hooks` condition. that's set with [`fuchsia_no_hooks` gclient config](https://crsrc.org/b/recipes/recipe_modules/chromium/gclient_config.py;drc=3888bddaf2a1a515ac82ee5f29fa684bd8368e43;l=153) which our builder sets [here](https://crsrc.org/c/infra/config/subprojects/chromium/ci/chromium.clang.star;drc=c0737fd3b1aef4cfa85a1318d81838af0620bcae;l=633), so it seems like it should be working?

entry.title: Right-click immediately selects whatever context menu item is under the cursor.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Right-click anywhere on any page. 2. 3.
# Problem Description Right-clicking opens the context menu and immediately selects the item under the cursor, resulting in either the first or last menu item being selected (depending on whether the menu opens up or down). Right-clicking, holding the button, moving the mouse away from the menu, then releasing the button results in the menu staying open as expected.
The problem is also reproducible in an incognito window. Right-click in other applications works fine.
I'm running on KDE with Wayland.
# Summary Right-click immediately selects whatever context menu item is under the cursor.
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: CDP method Page.getFrameTree with chrome.debugger API doesn't return cross-domain iframes
Increase win diff pool or decrease build trigger rate to avoid noisy pending time alerts
entry.content:
The windows bots in the `luci.chrome.official.diffs` pool are a frequent source of pending time alerts. eg: irm/i_7jz7aTjd3gXwokRomAGz irm/i_aV9nJgxprB4ZFqcT38UT irm/i_v22xPEobmndN726ThJKb
Its builds either take 1+ hour, it gets spammed with builds in a short period, or its machine pool is too small. Should address either of those things to avoid frequent pending time alerts for this pool. (Or just turn off the alerts?)

entry.title: Updating textarea defaultValue breaks minlength validation
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Add a textarea with minlength (say, 5) 2. Type fewer than 5 characters into the textarea 3. See textarea.validity.valid == false, CSS :invalid matches 4. Set textarea.defaultValue through JavaScript to something different than its current value 5. See textarea.validity.valid == true, CSS :invalid still matches
A HTML file that showcases the problem is attached.
# Problem Description When the defaultValue of a textarea is changed with JavaScript, it undoes or bypasses minlength constraint validation. The textarea's ValidityState will go from { valid: false, tooShort: true } to { valid: true, tooShort: false }. This can be a problem in frameworks like React if the defaultValue is set to a state variable and can change. Safari and Firefox do not share this behavior.
I would expect that changing the defaultValue doesn't change whether or not the textarea's actual value is valid, and that this validation would match the CSS :invalid state.
# Summary Updating textarea defaultValue breaks minlength validation
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Forms
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: clank instrumented build on aarch64: multiple __cyg_profile_func_enter_bare in one toplevel function
entry.content:
For the Clank orderfile generator we rely on `-finstrument-function-entry-bare` inserting the hook `_cyg_profile_func_enter_bare` after inlining. We then rely on identical inline decisions when we switch to the regular (uninstrumented build).
We are working now on switching the orderfile generator to aarch64. I noticed that for aarch64 we often have multiple calls to the hook from one toplevel function.
For example, here is a disassembly of `_ZN5blink14ResourceLoader16DidFinishLoadingEN4base9TimeTicksElml` (not in full, only the beginning):
``` 5b2378c: d503233f paciasp 5b23790: d102c3ff sub sp, sp, #0xb0 5b23794: a9067bfd stp x29, x30, [sp, #0x60] 5b23798: f9003bf9 str x25, [sp, #0x70] 5b2379c: a9085ff8 stp x24, x23, [sp, #0x80] 5b237a0: a90957f6 stp x22, x21, [sp, #0x90] 5b237a4: a90a4ff4 stp x20, x19, [sp, #0xa0] 5b237a8: 910183fd add x29, sp, #0x60 5b237ac: aa0403f5 mov x21, x4 5b237b0: aa0303f7 mov x23, x3 5b237b4: aa0203f6 mov x22, x2 5b237b8: aa0103f3 mov x19, x1 5b237bc: aa0003f4 mov x20, x0 5b237c0: 95b049e4 bl 0xc735f50 <__cyg_profile_func_enter_bare> 5b237c4: f00373d8 adrp x24, 0xc99e000 <__emutls_v._ZN8perfetto10DataSourceIN2v88internal14CodeDataSourceENS2_20CodeDataSourceTraitsEE10tls_state_E+0x18> 5b237c8: b9804288 ldrsw x8, [x20, #0x40] 5b237cc: f9404309 ldr x9, [x24, #0x80] 5b237d0: 8a080539 and x25, x9, x8, lsl #1 5b237d4: 395e4728 ldrb w8, [x25, #0x791] 5b237d8: 37180ac8 tbnz w8, #0x3, 0x5b23930 <_ZN5blink14ResourceLoader16DidFinishLoadingEN4base9TimeTicksElml+0x1a4> 5b237dc: 95b049dd bl 0xc735f50 <__cyg_profile_func_enter_bare> 5b237e0: f9047736 str x22, [x25, #0x8e8] 5b237e4: f9404309 ldr x9, [x24, #0x80] 5b237e8: b9804288 ldrsw x8, [x20, #0x40] 5b237ec: 8a080539 and x25, x9, x8, lsl #1 5b237f0: 95b049d8 bl 0xc735f50 <__cyg_profile_func_enter_bare> 5b237f4: f9047b37 str x23, [x25, #0x8f0] 5b237f8: f9404309 ldr x9, [x24, #0x80] 5b237fc: b9804288 ldrsw x8, [x20, #0x40] 5b23800: 8a080537 and x23, x9, x8, lsl #1 5b23804: 95b049d3 bl 0xc735f50 <__cyg_profile_func_enter_bare> 5b23808: f9047ef5 str x21, [x23, #0x8f8] 5b2380c: b9806289 ldrsw x9, [x20, #0x60] 5b23810: f900a693 str x19, [x20, #0x148] 5b23814: 340002e9 cbz w9, 0x5b23870 <_ZN5blink14ResourceLoader16DidFinishLoadingEN4base9TimeTicksElml+0xe4> 5b23818: 3941ea8a ldrb w10, [x20, #0x7a] 5b2381c: f9404308 ldr x8, [x24, #0x80] 5b23820: 370002aa tbnz w10, #0x0, 0x5b23874 <_ZN5blink14ResourceLoader16DidFinishLoadingEN4base9TimeTicksElml+0xe8> 5b23824: 8a090509 and x9, x8, x9, lsl #1 5b23828: 3940d929 ldrb w9, [x9, #0x36] 5b2382c: 35000249 cbnz w9, 0x5b23874 <_ZN5blink14ResourceLoader16DidFinishLoadingEN4base9TimeTicksElml+0xe8> 5b23830: 39422289 ldrb w9, [x20, #0x88] 5b23834: 37000069 tbnz w9, #0x0, 0x5b23840 <_ZN5blink14ResourceLoader16DidFinishLoadingEN4base9TimeTicksElml+0xb4> ```
I did not check whether it is a result of some aarch64 specifics or just a result of Clank/arm32 heavily discouraging inlining (for binary size reasons).
We recently changed the value of `-Wl,-mllvm,-import-instr-limit`, and it broke the orderfile pipeline, but I cannot attribute this breakage to the specific problem in this bug. It could be a combination of factors.
Here are our link flags (we are using thinlto and PGO): ``` -Wl,--version-script=gen/chrome/android/libmonochrome_64_linker_script.txt -Wl,--hash-style=gnu -Wl,-soname,libmonochrome_64.so --partitioned-library -Werror -fuse-ld=lld -Wl,--fatal-warnings -Wl,--build-id=sha1 -fPIC -Wl,-z,noexecstack -Wl,-z,relro -Wl,-z,now -Wl,--color-diagnostics -Wl,-mllvm,-instcombine-lower-dbg-declare=0 -Wl,-mllvm,-split-threshold-for-reg-with-hint=0 -fexperimental-relative-c++-abi-vtables -Wl,--thinlto-cache-dir=thinlto-cache -Wl,--thinlto-cache-policy=cache_size=10\%:cache_size_bytes=40g:cache_size_files=100000 -flto=thin -Wl,--thinlto-jobs=all -Wl,-mllvm,-import-instr-limit=5 -Wl,-mllvm,-disable-auto-upgrade-debug-info -fwhole-program-vtables -Wl,--no-rosegment -Wl,--undefined-version -Wl,--exclude-libs=libvpx_assembly_arm.a -Wl,-z,max-page-size=16384 --target=aarch64-linux-android26 -Wl,-mllvm,-enable-machine-outliner=never -no-canonical-prefixes -Wl,--warn-shared-textrel -Wl,-O2 -Wl,--gc-sections -Wl,-z,defs -Wl,--as-needed --unwindlib=none -nostdlib++ --sysroot=../../third_party/android_toolchain/ndk/toolchains/llvm/prebuilt/linux-x86_64/sysroot -Wl,-mllvm,-enable-ext-tsp-block-placement=1 -Wl,-u,__cyg_profile_func_enter_bare -Wl,-z,force-bti -Wl,--lto-O2 -Wl,--symbol-ordering-file -Wl,../../clank/orderfiles/orderfile.arm.out -Wl,--no-warn-symbol-ordering -Wl,--pack-dyn-relocs=relr,--use-android-relr-tags -Wl,-wrap,calloc -Wl,-wrap,free -Wl,-wrap,malloc -Wl,-wrap,memalign -Wl,-wrap,posix_memalign -Wl,-wrap,pvalloc -Wl,-wrap,realloc -Wl,-wrap,valloc -Wl,-wrap,malloc_usable_size -Wl,-wrap,realpath -Wl,-wrap,strdup -Wl,-wrap,strndup -Wl,-wrap,getcwd -Wl,-wrap,asprintf -Wl,-wrap,vasprintf -Wl,--dynamic-linker,/system/bin/linker64 -o "./lib.unstripped/libmonochrome_64__combined.so" @"./libmonochrome_64__combined.so.rsp" ```
... then follow a few libs
Contents of `libmonochrome_64__combined.so.rsp`: ``` -Wl,--whole-archive [... many objects ...] -Wl,--no-whole-archive ../../third_party/llvm-build/Release+Asserts/lib/clang/19/lib/linux/libclang_rt.builtins-aarch64-android.a -ldl -lm -landroid -llog -ljnigraphics ../../base/android/library_loader/anchor_functions.lds -lGLESv2 -laaudio -lnativewindow -lmediandk ```
args: ``` enable_resource_allowlist_generation = false is_chrome_branded = true is_debug = false is_official_build = true symbol_level = 1 target_os = "android" use_remoteexec = true use_order_profiling = true devtools_instrumentation_dumping = true target_cpu = "arm64" ```
